completions.nl_description: Identify the smallest object and move it towards the largest object if they are neighbors.
Move all objects of size greater than 1 towards neighboring green objects, then recolor the green objects to blue.
For each pair of neighboring objects, move the object that is further up to the right and recolor both objects to B. If one of the objects is initially colored G, move it upwards.
Recolor all objects of color O to color B, if they are neighbors of any object of color G.
Move all non-border objects of color G towards the object of color B, and add a border to them with color B.
Move all objects of size 1 one step down and then color them blue.
Move objects toward the nearest object of color G if they are neighbors of it, and then recolor them to color B.
Move all objects of color G below the first G encountered up to the same row as the first G encountered.
Move objects of size 1 in the direction of the closest object of size greater than 1.
Move all objects of color different than O to the objects of color O in maximum distance.
Move all objects of size 3 or less towards the closest object of color G, if they are neighbors of it.
Move all green (G) objects one step up, and then color the objects they land on (if any) blue (B).
completions.code:
(do
    (rule
        (vars (this))
        (filter (color_equals (color_of this) G) )
        (apply (move_node up) )
    )
    (rule
        (vars (this))
        (filter (color_equals (color_of this) G) )
        (apply (update_color B) )
    )
)

completions.nl_description: For objects of size 1, extend the object in the direction of the nearest object of size greater than 1, then recolor the extended object to B.
Move all green objects towards a neighboring object, then recolor them to blue.
Move all objects of size bigger than 1 towards another object until they intersect.
All objects move towards the green objects if they are neighbors and then change their color to blue.
Move all objects of color different than O towards the nearest G object if they are neighbors of it.
Move all objects of size 1 towards the object of size 6, recoloring the moved objects to their original color.
Move all objects of color G to be neighbors of the closest object of color B
Move all objects of color G to their rightmost neighboring position, then turn the original objects into color B.
Move all objects of color B, G, or R one step down.
Move all object of color G toward the closest object that has color B
Move all objects of color G toward the border, perform another move in the direction of their respective column, and then recolor them to color B.
Move all objects of size 1 and color B towards the nearest object of size greater than 1, if they are neighbors.
Move green objects toward neighboring blue objects without overlapping.
Move all objects of color G one step left and then recolor them to color B.
Move all objects of size 1 horizontally toward the object of size 3, and then recolor them to color B.
Move all objects of size 1 towards the nearest object to the left.
Move all objects of color G, B, or R to the nearest G object, and recolor them to color B.
Move all objects of color G one step toward B if they are neighbors.
Move all objects of size 1 toward the object of color G, and recolor the moved objects to color B.
Move all objects of color G toward the object of color B, if they are neighbors of it.
Move all objects of color B one step toward the nearest neighbor, and recolor them to color B.
Move all G objects and their neighbors to the L shape, forming a new larger L object.
Extend all objects adjacent to 'G' color objects, in the direction of the 'G' color objects, without overlapping.
Move all the objects of size 3 towards the object of color G, then recolor them to B.
Move all objects of color G or B down if they are neighbors of other objects, and then recolor them to color B.
Move all objects of color different than Y, toward the nearest Y object, and then recolor them to retain their original color and Y.
Move objects of color G that are neighbors of objects of color B, in the direction of the objects of color B, until they hit other objects.
Move all objects of color G one step down, and then recolor the objects of size 1 to color B.
Move objects of shape enclosed and color Blue upward.
Move all objects of color G toward the object of color B in their row or column recursively.
Move all objects of size 1 towards the object of maximum size.
Insert a new object near each existing green object and recolor it to different colors.
Move objects of color G towards objects of color B if they are neighbors.
Move all objects of size 1 toward the object of maximum size and then recolor them to color B.
Move all objects of size 1 toward the nearest object of color G and then change their color to B.
Move non-neighbor objects with different color compared to the neighbor object G one step toward G, if they are not already neighbors.
Move all objects of color G, one step up, and then recolor them to color B.
Recolor all objects neighbored by a R to B.
Move all objects with color B one step to the right.
Move all objects of color G towards the closest object of color R until hitting another object or the grid boundary
Move all objects of color G one step down and then recolor them to color B.
Move all objects of color G one step toward objects of color B if they are neighbors, and then recolor those objects of color B.
Move the largest objects toward the smallest object if they are neighbors, and recolor them blue.
Move the maximum-size objects towards the objects of color G, if they are neighbors, and then recolor them to color B.
Move all yellow lines one step left, and then recolor them to green.
Move all objects of color G a maximum of two steps.
Move all objects of color G toward other objects if they are neighbors, else recolor them to B.
Move all objects of color G (except those that are neighbors of B) one step upward, and then recolor them to color B.
Move all objects of color G towards objects of color B if they are neighbors, and recolor the moved objects to color B.
Move all objects of color B or G downward until they hit another object.
Recolor all objects of color G, B, and R to their corresponding neighboring object's color, except for black.
Move all non-Y objects, size 1, towards the Y object in the same column, if they are below it.
Move all objects of color G that are neighbors of other objects, toward those objects' direction without overlapping
Move all the objects of size 3 toward the object of color G, if they are neighbors of it, and recolor them to color B after moving.
Move all objects toward the green objects if they are neighbors of them.
Move objects colored G, R, B towards the largest object of color Y.
Move all objects of color 'G' one step down.
Move all objects of size 1 towards neighboring objects of size greater than 1, without overlapping, then recolor them to color B.
Move all objects of color B one step downward.
Move all objects of color B toward objects of color G, if they are neighbors of them.
Add a border of the same color around each grid object with size greater than 1.
Move all objects of color G or B toward the nearest object of color Y.
Move all objects of color G one step down, and then recolor them to color B.
Move all objects of color G one step left, and then recolor them to color B.
Move all G objects to B objects if they are neighbors and recolor them to G.
Move all objects of color different than O and Y towards the nearest object of color O, if they are neighbors of it.
Move objects of size 1 downward and recolor objects of size 2 to color B
Move all objects that are neighbors of color Y upwards, and recolor them if necessary.
Move all objects of size 1 towards the nearest neighbor if they are of size greater than 1.
Move all objects of color G one step to the right, then recolor them to B.
Move all objects of color B, G, or R toward the object of color Y if they are neighbors of it, then recolor those objects moved to neighbor with Y to color B.
Insert objects of colors G and B in grids towards the bottom, moving smaller objects step by step.
Move objects colored G, B, or R in a direction towards the nearest objects of color Y, then change the color of the moved objects to B.
Move all objects of color G, B, and R towards the object of color Y if they are neighbors of it.
If a red object is adjacent, move the objects upward and change their color, otherwise retain their position.
Move all objects toward the nearest green object without overlapping.
Move all objects of color G one step left and then change their color to B.
Move all objects of size 1 towards the nearest green (G) object, and recolor them based on their original color: R to B, and B to G.
Move all objects of size 1 toward the object of maximum size. Then recolor them.
Move all objects one step toward their closest neighbor of a different color.
Insert blue squares at the positions of the smallest-sized objects.
Move all objects of color different than Y, B, and G toward the nearest yellow object if they are neighbors.
Move objects neighboring a 'R' object towards the nearest 'R' object based on their direction, then set their color to 'B'.
Move all objects of size 3 in any direction toward the objects of maximum size.
Move all objects of color B and G one step down.
Move all objects whose color is B one step in the up direction.
Recolor all objects of color O (black) to color G (green), except for objects that are neighbors of an object colored R (red).
Move all objects of color 'O' diagonally up-left and recolor them with the same color of their neighbor. Then, extend nodes of color 'G' to up-left without overlapping.
Move objects labeled with 'G' upward to the nearest position where there is no overlap, then recolor all neighbors of 'G' objects to 'B'.
Move blue objects towards the green objects if they are neighbors, then recolor the blue objects to yellow.
Move all objects of color G towards the nearest object of color B, then change their color to B.
Move all objects of color G one step up, and then recolor them to color B.
Insert a green pixel next to any vertical segments of 3 yellow pixels.
Move all objects of color B one step down, and then recolor them to color B if not already colored B.
Move all objects towards the nearest object of color G if they are neighbors.
Move all objects to the nearest object of color G if they are neighbors, and change their color to B.
Move all objects of color G one step left, and then recolor them to color B.
Move the object of color G to the nearest position of an object of color B.
Move all objects of color G toward the object of color B, if they are neighbors. Also, move objects of color B one step up.
